com.ibm.mobile.services.location.geo.triggers

Class IBMGeoPositionChangeTrigger

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ibm.mobile.services.location.IBMAbstractTrigger
      • com.ibm.mobile.services.location.geo.triggers.IBMGeoTrigger
        • com.ibm.mobile.services.location.geo.triggers.IBMGeoPositionChangeTrigger
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable

    public class IBMGeoPositionChangeTrigger
extends IBMGeoTrigger
    A trigger for tracking changes in the device's position. It is possible to specify a minimum distance that must be moved before the trigger will activate. The IBMGeoPositionChangeTrigger class is a provisional API. APIs that are marked provisional are evolving and might change or be removed in future releases.

    • Method Detail

      • getMinChangeDistance

        public double getMinChangeDistance()
        Returns:
        The minimum change distance before the trigger will execute the callback.

      • setMinChangeDistance

        public void setMinChangeDistance(double minChangeDistance)
        After the first acquisition, this trigger will be activated only when the reported position has changed by at least minChangeDistance amount. This is different from setting the parameter in IBMGeoAcquisitionPolicy.setMinChangeDistance(int) as other triggers may still activate due to changes in the device's position, and no power will be saved by using this method.
        Parameters:
        minChangeDistance - the minimum distance in meters which the position must change by in order for this trigger object to be activated. The value should be greater than that of the parameter set in IBMGeoAcquisitionPolicy.setMinChangeDistance(int), otherwise it will have no effect.

      • clone

        public IBMGeoPositionChangeTrigger clone()
